body:
Comment 4 by **paulo.jpinto**: 
This breaks expectations, as referred on my submission, even though Win32 supports
forward slashes, no one expects to use them. See my code examples below.

As for your pattern example, every knowledgeable Windows developer knows that such a
pattern needs to be written as 'c:\\*.*', with double slashes.

Python:
>>> import os
>>> os.sep
'\\'
>>>


JVM using Groovy
groovy> println System.properties.get("file.separator")
\

.Net using C#
class Demo {
  public static void Main() {
    System.Console.WriteLine (System.IO.Path.DirectorySeparatorChar);
  }
}

Output: \
